Produksi Perdana Bus Listrik MAB DIserahkan ke Paiton Energy
02 Nov 2019, 10:07 by Bisnis.com, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT Mobil Anak Bangsa (MAB) secara resmi menyerahkan hasil produksi perdananya yakni bus listrik MAB 12E NF kepada PT Paiton Energy di Demak Jawa Tengah Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Adapun, penyerahan bus listrik tersebut dilakukan langsung oleh Founder MAB Moeldoko kepada Presiden Direktur Paiton Energy Koichiro Miyazaki.
Penyerahan bus listrik hari ini merupakan hasil penjualan komersial yang dilakukan MAB berdasarkan Service Procurement Agreement yang telah ditandatangani, 2 Juli 2019.
Bus listrik ini dapat memuat 45 orang penumpang, dengan pengisian baterai hanya membutuhkan waktu dua jam saja.
Founder PT MAB Moeldoko mengatakan, mobil listrik ini diproduksi mulai bulan Maret 2016 dan sekarang sudah memasuki generasi keempat atau koemersial.
"Kami memasuki generasi keempat atau koemersial, karena mulai hari ini MAB mulai melakukan delivery order dan yang pertama dari PT Paiton Energy.
Rencana Paiton akan membeli lagi produksi dari PT MAB," kata Moeldoko usai melakukan penyerahan Bus Listrik MAB 12E NF kepada PT Paiton Energy.
Presiden Direktur PT MAB Leonard mengatakan, Bus listrik MD 12E NF merupakan hasil kerja keras MAB dalam mewujudkan kemampuan produksi bus listrik karya anak bangsa yang sudah diterima dengan baik oleh paiton sebagai pembeli produk.
"Kedepannya kami akan terus memproduksi kendaraaan listrik dengan berbagai type baik yang berukuran 12 meter, 8 meter maupun kendaran listrik angkutan umum yang berukuran Iebih kecil dari 8 meter. Kami berharap produk ini akan dapat mendukung upaya pemerintah dalam mengurangi polusi udara," katanya.
Sementara itu, Direktur Paiton Energy Koichiro Miyazaki mengaku sangat senang dapat membeli bus listrik produksi PT MAB.
Menurutnya, menggunakan kendaraan listrik penting karena tidak menimbulkan polusi udara.
"Saya senang dapat membeli bus listrik ini, kedepan kami akan membeli lagi produk buatan dari PT MAB," katanya.

Prime Production of MAB Electric Bus is Handed over to Paiton Energy
02 Nov 2019, 10:07 by Bisnis.com, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT Mobil Anak Bangsa (MAB) officially handed over its first production, the MAB 12E NF electric bus to PT Paiton Energy in Demak, Central Java Saturday, November 2, 2019.
Meanwhile, the handover of the electric bus was done directly by MAB Founder Moeldoko to the President Director of Paiton Energy Koichiro Miyazaki.
The delivery of electric buses today is the result of commercial sales conducted by MAB based on a signed Service Procurement Agreement, July 2, 2019.
This electric bus can load 45 passengers, charging the battery only takes two hours.
PT MAB founder Moeldoko said, this electric car was produced starting in March 2016 and now has entered the fourth generation or commercial.
"We are entering the fourth generation or commercialization, because starting today MAB began to make delivery orders and the first from PT Paiton Energy.
The Paiton plan will buy more production from PT MAB, "Moeldoko said after delivering the MAB 12E NF Electric Bus to PT Paiton Energy.
President Director of PT MAB Leonard said, the MD 12E NF electric bus is the result of MAB's hard work in realizing the ability to produce electric bus works of the nation's children that have been well received by Paiton as a product buyer.
"In the future, we will continue to produce electric vehicles with various types, both 12 meters, 8 meters and public transport vehicles smaller than 8 meters. We hope this product will be able to support the government's efforts to reduce air pollution," he said.
Meanwhile, Paiton Energy Director Koichiro Miyazaki said he was very happy to be able to buy an electric bus produced by PT MAB.
According to him, using electric vehicles is important because it does not cause air pollution.
"I am pleased to be able to buy this electric bus, in the future we will buy more products made from PT MAB," he said.
